page.title: 20THE OLD BAPTIST CHURCH
page.content: A little baptist chappel was built on Reddy lane over 200 years ago.Worshippers came from as far away as Stockport,and services were held in secret.The chappelis derelict now,but it was a plain building,simply furnished with oak pews, a pulpit and oil lamps.a caretaker's house was built on to the chappel,later a whole row of cottages was added.The decendents of the caretaker occupied the house for over a century.Large gravestones and tombs are crowded together, filling the small front garden. The building was sold in 1985 to a private buyer.
